meanings.definition: (past tense verb) To treat someone unfairly or harshly.
meanings.sent1: He felt dicked when his friend didn't invite him to the party.
meanings.sent2: She was dicked by her boss for being late to work.
meanings.sent3: The cat dicked the dog by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm dicked the garden, destroying all the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher dicked the students by giving them extra homework.

meanings.definition: (adjective) An informal term used to describe something that is broken or not functioning properly.
meanings.sent1: The dicked computer wouldn't turn on no matter what he tried.
meanings.sent2: She was frustrated with the dicked phone that kept dropping calls.
meanings.sent3: The dicked toaster only toasted one side of the bread.
meanings.sent4: His car was so dicked that it broke down on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The dicked TV screen showed only static, no matter the channel.
